channel.title: How to Make a Melody Feel Like it Should Repeat?
channel.description: So I've been working on a song but the melody and chords feel like it ends and shouldn't repeat. Does anybody have advice?

item.title: How to Make a Melody Feel Like it Should Repeat?
item.dc:creator: Southborne
item.description:
for some real tension- make the last note of the melody 4 steps higher than the first note of the melody. for instance… if your melody starts on the 1 note (A for example) end the melody on the 5 (E) you can design chords in the same way also. build a chord for the end that starts on the 5 and it should want to resolve back to the beginning again.

item.title: How to Make a Melody Feel Like it Should Repeat?
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
It can sound weird when something loops where the first note of the loop is far away pitch wise from the last note. So you gotta make the loop lead back to itself. This could mean having the last note be one note/scale degree away from the first. Gotta smooth out those lines. And like others have said, with chords if you’re landing on the tonic chord at the end of a phrase it’s going to sound very final.

item.title: How to Make a Melody Feel Like it Should Repeat?
item.dc:creator: lowey
item.description:
Yeah, presumably it sounds like it shouldn’t repeat because you’ve resolved the progression (I.e. reached the root of the key). Omitting the final chord may achieve the unresolved sound, or changing to another chord might create the right tension. Sometimes I replace the chord with a short melody that leads towards (but does not reach) the root note.
